intro: Machaerina flexuosa subsp. flexuosa, commonly known as the flexible machaerina, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and dense, leathery leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It is typically found in coastal and lowland areas, thriving in well-drained soils. This subspecies is noted for its adaptability to various environmental conditions and is often used in horticultural settings.
